videoPlayer

Class VideoPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.StackPane
              • videoPlayer.VideoPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class VideoPlayer
extends javafx.scene.layout.StackPane
    VideoPlayer is used to play .mp4 video files. Allows simple controls over the video such as play, pause, stop, fast forward, rewind (currently unsupported) and scrubbing through the video via a slider. Also gives the user control over the media volume (does not change the system volume) and allows the user to toggle the video between full screen and a regular window.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Steven Proctor

    • Method Detail

      • initControlBar

        private void initControlBar()
        Loads the controlBar from a .fxml file. Adds the control bar to the pane and sets all event handlers.

      • initMenuBar

        private void initMenuBar()
        Loads the menuBar from a .fxml file. Adds the menu bar to the pane and sets all the event handlers.

      • initMediaPlayer

        private void initMediaPlayer(java.io.File videoFile)
        Initializes the Media, MediaPlayer, and MediaView. Adds the mediaView to the pane. Sets the media ready event handler.
        Parameters:
        videoFile - File object containing the video to be played

      • checkKey

        private void checkKey(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
        Checks to see if the key that was pressed was the spaceBar.
        Parameters:
        event - keyboard event

      • playVideo

        private void playVideo(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Plays the video if the video is paused. Otherwise plays the video. Toggles the icons in controlBar.
        Parameters:
        event - action event

      • fastForwardVideo

        private void fastForwardVideo(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Increases the rate at which the video plays. Increments from x1 to x4 to x7 then loops back to x1.
        Parameters:
        event - action event

      • rewindVideo

        private void rewindVideo(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Current unsupported
        Parameters:
        event - action event

      • stopVideo

        private void stopVideo(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Pauses the video and returns the video to the beginning.
        Parameters:
        event - action event

      • expandVideo

        private void expandVideo(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Toggles the video between full screen and a smaller window.
        Parameters:
        event - action event

      • openFile

        private void openFile(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Opens a file chooser to selected a new file to play. Supports .mp4 and .m4v video files. Calls initMedia if the File exists.
        Parameters:
        event - action event.

      • closeFile

        private void closeFile(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Closes the current file and resets all values and visibilities to their default values.
        Parameters:
        event - action event

      • quitProgram

        private void quitProgram(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Terminates the program
        Parameters:
        event - action event

      • displayControls

        private void displayControls(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Displays the controlBar and menuBar. Then calls hideControls.
        Parameters:
        event - mouse event

      • hideControls

        private void hideControls(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Starts a timer that will hide the controlBar and menuBar after 5 seconds.
        Parameters:
        event - mouse event

      • updateSliders

        private void updateSliders()
        Starts a timer that updates the value of the video slider every second

      • mouseEnteredControlBox

        private void mouseEnteredControlBox(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Keeps the controlBar and menuBar visible if the mouse enters the controlBar
        Parameters:
        event - mouseEvent
